text:
Manifest ID: https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/works/42fc42b6-8ff3-45f4-bf50-57db8f8e7e5d?as=iiif
Title: Good bless America and the world, Barack Obama.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Multicolor painting on rough-hewn plywood panel with white primer. Type of paint not identified. Painting has Barack Obama in blue suit and red and white striped tie gazing and pointing with right arm. Portrait of George W. Bush to left superimposed on green image of continent of Africa with "God bless America and the world" in white lettering. Background of painting is flag of United States in reverse; stars of flag replaced by "Barack Obama" and stylized stars in white. Painting has solid green at bottom. Painting originally displayed at a barber shop.
Contributor: unknown South African (Manufacturer)
Date: 2009?
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies
Dimensions: 76 x 61 cm
Genre: paintings (visual works)
Identifier: Obama 426
Last Modified: 2022-02-25T19:39:54.543081Z
Materials: 1 painting : wood, paint
Provenance: South Africa.
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Bush, George W. (George Walker), 1946-, Bush, George W. (George Walker), 1946-, Portraits, Barbershops, South Africa, Obama, Barack

metadata.title: Good bless America and the world, Barack Obama.

text:
Manifest ID: https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/works/a6b0acb9-b960-4c1b-ba9b-abb904347a2f?as=iiif
Title: Round Barrack Obama rear-view mirror decoration.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Rear-view mirror hanging made from a flat, round glass medallion decorated on both sides with a full color photographic portrait of Barack Obama on an American flag background. Has the phrase "Change we can believe in" in yellow and the caption "Barrack Obama" in white. A hanging loop made from red cord with a multicolored knotwork element is attached to the medallion at its top and two red tassels are attached to the bottom.
Alternate Title: Round Barack Obama rear-view mirror decoration.
Contributor: unknown African (Artist)
Date: 2008?
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies
Dimensions: 34 x 5 cm
Genre: decorations (ornamental works)
Identifier: Obama 27b
Last Modified: 2022-02-25T19:39:55.247390Z
Materials: 1 decoration : glass, cordage, metal findings
Provenance: Kenya; purchased.
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Souvenirs (Keepsakes), Obama, Barack

metadata.title: Round Barrack Obama rear-view mirror decoration.

text:
Manifest ID: https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/works/7c802e54-5e46-4a75-b4c7-b2514c85f257?as=iiif
Title: "Change we can believe in" lighter.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Plastic lighter with multicolor images of Barack Obama. Lighter top is white with metal apparatus with name of manufacturer stamped on front and back. Lighter front has image of Obama wearing tuxedo superimposed on yellow and blue sky pattern. "Change we can believe in" in yellow lettering above image, "Barack Obama" in white lettering at bottom of image. Lighter back has same image and lettering superimposed on faint image of a stadium.
Contributor: Baide Lighter Industrial Co. (Manufacturer), unknown Guinean (Manufacturer)
Date: 2009
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies
Dimensions: 23 x 82 x 82 mm
Genre: lighters (fire-making equipment)
Identifier: Obama 203
Last Modified: 2022-02-25T19:39:56.696048Z
Materials: 1 lighter : plastic, metal
Provenance: Guinea.
Publisher: Baide.
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Souvenirs (Keepsakes), Guinea, Obama, Barack

text:
Manifest ID: https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/works/025c25b4-77a7-49a2-b6e0-23e614251b0d?as=iiif
Title: Obama jeans.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Tan jeans with faux leather patch on waist. Patch is tan and stamped with "Obama" in light tan lettering. Back pockets have faux leather patches with "Jeans Wear", the name of manufacturer, in red lettering. Paper labels and tags attached to jeans include photo of Obama in front of the Capitol Building and "Obama Jeans Wear. New fashion wear."
Contributor: Jeans Wear (Firm) (Manufacturer)
Date: 2010?
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies
Dimensions: size 32.
Genre: jeans
Identifier: Obama 249
Last Modified: 2022-02-25T19:39:56.079030Z
Materials: 1 pair of jeans : cotton, metal
Provenance: Zambia.
Publisher: Jeans Wear
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Souvenirs (Keepsakes), Obama, Barack

text:
Manifest ID: https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/works/4c0790f6-ae02-42cd-9efb-26f3dd508184?as=iiif
Title: Obama '08 t-shirt.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Orange t-shirt short-sleeved t-shirt with multicolor silkscreen on front and back. Front of t-shirt: portrait of Barack Obama superimposed on flag of Kenya with "Obama '08" in white lettering below. Back of t-shirt: "Ndio tunaweza" (translation: yes we can) in Swahili black capital lettering on two lines.
Contributor: unknown Kenyan (Manufacturer)
Date: 2010
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies
Dimensions: size 70 cm, 57 x 66 cm irregular.
Genre: T-shirts
Identifier: Obama 279
Last Modified: 2022-02-25T19:39:54.543081Z
Materials: 1 t-shirt : cotton, vinyl
Provenance: Kenya.
Publisher: Master-Knit
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Souvenirs (Keepsakes), Kenya, Obama, Barack

text:
Manifest ID: https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/works/e0beb4a7-551a-40bb-be1f-9d43decbcef9?as=iiif
Title: Obama Africa spiral smoothline ballpoint pen.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Magenta box of 50 ball-point pens. Pens are in orange, red, blue, and green with colored cap and swirl pattern on barrel. Box front has "Obama Africa spiral smoothline ballpoint pen" at top in white and yellow lettering with image of pens at middle. "Spiral smoothline high class technology, 50 pc." at bottom in in white and yellow lettering. Box front and back have identical design. Manufacturer's and producer's information on one box side with UPC symbol on opposite side.
Contributor: Regal Impex Ltd. (Distributor), Kimaya Impex Pvt. Ltd. (Manufacturer)
Creator: unknown
Date: 2010
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies
Dimensions: 15 cm in box 15 x 8 x 8 cm
Genre: ball-point pens
Identifier: Obama 326
Last Modified: 2022-02-25T19:39:53.665258Z
Materials: 1 box, 50 pens : plastic, metal, ink
Provenance: Tanzania.
Publisher: Regal Impex Ltd., Kimaya Impex Pvt. Ltd.
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Souvenirs (Keepsakes), Tanzania, Obama, Barack

text:
Manifest ID: https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/works/1e493b9e-7da0-484d-bdc5-66abe20f5601?as=iiif
Title: Wishing you success in your exams, Barrak Obama.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Paper greeting card with multicolor images on front and back. Greeting card front has portrait of Barack Obama superimposed on flags of the United States. "Wishing you success in your exams, Barrak Obama" in multicolor text above portrait. Greeting card back has portrait of Barack Obama superimposed on single flag of the United States with "Made in Kenya" in white lettering on a blue oval to left of portrait. Text within card is black on a white background.
Alternate Title: Wishing you success in your exams, Barack Obama
Contributor: unknown Kenyan (Manufacturer)
Date: 2009?
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies
Dimensions: 21 x 29 folded to 21 cm
Genre: greeting cards
Identifier: Obama 34
Last Modified: 2022-02-25T19:39:54.025402Z
Materials: 1 greeting card : color illustration
Provenance: Kenya.
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Souvenirs (Keepsakes), Kenya, Obama, Barack

text:

Title: Obama 09, the face of change flip-flop sandals.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Black and red rubber, vinyl, and foam flip-flop thong sandals with an inverted-v foot strap. Footbed has stylized gray image of Obama. The footbed and the inner foot strap of both shoes has the phrase "Obama '09" in red and "The face of change" in white.
Alternate Title: Face of change flip-flop sandals
Creator: unknown
Date: 2009?
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies

Identifier: Obama 202a

Provenance: Republic of Guinea.
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Souvenirs (Keepsakes), Obama, Barack

text:
Manifest ID: https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/works/9eceb2e3-e5f4-400d-9e39-8d2b667ec0ad?as=iiif
Title: Barack Obama, America's first black president.
Part Of: Africa Embracing Obama (https://api.dc.library.northwestern.edu/api/v2/collections/ecacd539-fe38-40ec-bbc0-590acee3d4f2?as=iiif)
Summary: Multicolor painting on unfinished plywood panel with white primer. Type of paint not identified; likely in oil. Portrait of Barack Obama in brown dress suit at right speaking into microphone and pointing left. Flag of the United States in background with "Barack Obama, America's first black president" in black and yellow lettering below stars. Signature of artists and date of painting at lower left in black lettering.
Contributor: Heavy J., O. A. (Artist)
Date: 2009
Department: Herskovits Library of African Studies
Dimensions: 47 x 61 cm
Genre: paintings (visual works)
Identifier: Obama 450a
Last Modified: 2022-02-25T19:39:56.079030Z
Materials: 1 painting : wood, paint
Provenance: Ghana.
Publisher: O.A. Heavy J
Rights Statement: Copyright Undetermined
Subject: Portraits, Ghana, Obama, Barack

metadata.title: Barack Obama, America's first black president.
